question: 1. Traffic rules have been laid down as an every one set of commitments that must be observed by everyone to ensure safe and smooth road traffic.

2. Flashing red light where there was a signal with a flashing red light, you traveled slowly by paying attention to other traffic because it was late at night, there was light traffic and you did not recognize any dangers.
3. If a vehicle is rapidly approaching the stopping point at an intersection and cannot stop safely when the green signal changes to yellow, it may continue to go through the intersection.
4. This traffic sign means 'one way.'
5. This traffic sign indicates that there is a school or preschool nearby. I so you have to use caution because children may be running out into the streets.
6. Large trucks and specified medium trucks are not allowed to travel on a road with this traffic sign while heavy duty special vehicles are allowed to travel.
7. This traffic sign indicates that regular passenger vehicles, large motorcycles, regular motorcycles, and mopeds are not allowed to travel.
8. This traffic sign indicates that vehicles are not allowed to travel due to a road ahead.
9. Mopeds can enter a road with this traffic sign.
10. This traffic sign indicates that any vehicles except for two-wheeled vehicles are not allowed to travel in any directions other than in the directions indicated by the arrows.
11. On a road with this traffic sign, large and regular motorcycles are not allowed to travel while mopeds are allowed to travel.
12. When the car is traveling in the direction indicated by the arrow, this road marking indicates that there is a priority road ahead.
13. A holder of a heavy-duty special vehicle license is allowed to drive a large vehicle and light-duty special vehicle.
14. A holder of a regular vehicle license is not allowed to drive a light-duty special vehicle but is allowed to drive a moped.
15. When you drive to tow a vehicle with a total vehicular weight (the weight of the vehicle plus passengers and load) of 750 kg or less, a towing license is not required.
16. When you press the middle section of the fan belt of a vehicle with your hand to check the belt and the fan belt bends a little, there is no problem with the fan belt.
17. A driver of a regular truck has to do a daily inspection of the regular truck.
18. You can carry a child on the carrier of a moped if the child is less than 6 years old.
19. When a large, medium, or regular vehicle is loaded, the load should not exceed the width of the vehicle.
20. Passenger capacity is defined as the number of passengers excluding a driver.
21. You do not need to slow down before and after a tunnel because your eyesight is not affected by the change in the brightness of natural light.
22. When traveling a particular distance, a vehicle's fuel consumption is not affected by the speed of a vehicle.
23. When a vehicle is loaded, the total length of the load should not exceed the vehicle length by more than 20%.
24. When you get out of a vehicle, you should open the door slightly and check for traffic approaching from behind.
25. You got lost, so you were looking at the screen of a vehicle navigation system while driving.
26. You can use your cell phone while driving if you are confident that you will not cause a traffic accident.
27. When you use a child seat in the front seat of a vehicle that is equipped with a passenger-side airbag, it is better to move the child seat as forward as possible.
28. When you drive a vehicle that is equipped with an airbag, you do not need to fasten your seat belt.
29. When you reverse a vehicle where visibility is poor, you need to ask someone in your vehicle to check for traffic.
30. A vehicle may enter the right side of a one-way road.
31. When a vehicle passes another, the vehicle ahead on the road as shown in this picture, the vehicle can enter the right side of the road.
32. If a road has three lanes or more in each direction, the lanes on the far right should be used for overtaking.
33. You noticed the siren of an emergency vehicle, but you were already entering an intersection, so you stopped at the intersection to give way to the emergency vehicle.

34. When a bus signal to move away from a bus stop a vehicle coming from behind must not interfere with the bus starting to travel, except for when a driver of a vehicle needs to slam on the brakes or turn the steering wheel sharply to avoid the bus.
35. Light-duty special vehicles, mopeds, and lightweight vehicles can use the lane on the road with this sign or marking.
36. When you were traveling on a priority lane for buses or similar vehicles, a bus was approaching from behind and you continued to use the priority lane because other lanes were congested.
37. You are banned from stopping or parking a vehicle on the side strip shown in this picture but you are allowed to drive.
38. You are banned from stopping or parking a vehicle on the side strip shown in this picture but you are allowed to drive.
39. You must not drive on the shoulder of a road (0.5m from the edge of a road) when passing a road without a sidewalk or side strip.
40. When passing near pedestrians or cyclists, you must keep a safe distance from them or proceed at a slow speed.
41. A shown in this picture when seeing the vehicle B stopping before the pedestrian crossing a driver of the vehicle A must slow down to pass the vehicle B.
42. You must slow down and check for safety when passing by a school bus stopping on the street.
43. If speed limit is not specified by a traffic sign or marking, you must not drive faster than 60 km/h when you drive a regular truck.
44. When you drive on a slippery road stepping on the brake several times is effective.
45. When approaching an intersection with this traffic sign that does not allow you to look left and right completely you must drive slowly.
46. When approaching the top of an uphill road, you do not have to drive slowly if there is no 'drive slow' traffic sign posted on the road.
47. When changing lanes, turning (marking a U-turn) reversing (backing) or the like, you must signal after checking for safety by using the rear view mirror.
48. When you make a U-turn you must signal 3 seconds before doing it.
49. Extending your left arm horizontally while riding a motorcycle indicates turning left or changing to the left lane.
50. You must stop signaling immediately once you have finished turning right or left.
51. You must sound your horn and must not stop sounding your horn when passing a place where this traffic sign is posted.
52. This traffic sign means No U-turn.
53. Overtaking is prohibited at a railroad crossing, pedestrian crossing, a bicycle crossing lane and any areas within 30m before them.
54. Overtaking is prohibited in tunnels even if they have lanes.
55. On a road with traffic sign, you must not change lanes or pass by vehicles or mopeds for overtaking.
56. When you are overtaking a streetcar you must pass it on its right.
57. You can enter a zone on a road designated by this traffic marking in front of police station or fire station if an emergency vehicle is not coming out of the pace.
58. Parking and stopping are not prohibited at the corner or road if they are not prohibited by a traffic sign.

59. When you pass through a railroad crossing, you must stop just before it (or behind the near side of the stopping line if any), and check for safety, but if you have a good visibility at a railroad crossing, you can pass through it by slowing down.

60. When you stop your car on an uphill road following the vehicle in front of you, you should not get too close to the vehicle in front, as to avoid a collision in the case that the other vehicle slides backward.
61. If the road has a cliff off to one side and it is not safe for two vehicles to pass each other safely, then the vehicle on the cliff side should stop and give way.
62. You have to drive more slowly at night than during the daytime because you tend to speed at night due to not being able to judge speed accurately.
63. You should avoid entering deep puddles on the road, because muddy water might enter the brake drum, causing the brake not to work at all or function effectively.

64. If the engine revolutions do not decline from high speed levels due to malfunction, you should shift the gear into neutral to divert the power of the engine from the wheels to move the vehicle to a safe place.
65. If the rear wheels of your vehicle start to skid, you should slam on the brakes, because it is difficult to set the vehicle in the direction by just adjusting the steering wheel.
66. When you drive in fog, you should sound your horn whenever necessary to prevent danger.
67. If your car stalls on a railroad crossing or an intersection, you should try to restart the engine by running the starter motor in either low or second gear.
68. If your vehicle has a flat tire while you are driving at high speed, you should slam on the brakes to stop quickly, because your vehicle may move in the wrong direction in a dangerous way.
69. Main lanes of the expressway include acceleration lanes, deceleration lanes, and slow lanes.
70. When traveling on a main lane of the expressway which is not divided for each direction, the speed limit for ordinary road is applied.
71. The speed limit for regular vehicles traveling on a main lane of the expressway that has a median strip is 80 km/h.
72. Hydroplaning is a phenomenon where the overuse of the foot brake on a long downhill road might cause the brake to overheat and fail suddenly.
73. When driving on the expressway, you drove on the side strip of the expressway because of a traffic jam.
74. You parked your vehicle on the sufficiently wide shoulder of an expressway due to vehicle break down for unavoidable reason.
75. If your vehicle breaks down on an expressway, it is safe to stay inside the vehicle after calling for a tow truck.
76. You should choose a motorcycle that fits the size of your body and allows your toes to touch the ground when you are seated.
77. When riding a motorcycle, motorcyclists should wear clothing that covers their body as fully as possible.
78. Double riding is not permitted when riding on a large or regular motorcycle without a rear seat.
79. When a rider who has had a license for regular motorcycles for less than one year rides a regular motorcycle, double riding is not permitted.
80. When riding on a motorcycle, it is better to make the drive chain of the motorcycle too tight and make the steering system of the motorcycle too stiff to maintain the motorcycle's balance.
81. When maneuvering a curve, tilt the motorcycle naturally rather than turning the handle bars.
82. When riding your motorcycle on muddy or gravel roads, you should go fast by accelerating your vehicle.

83. When you ride a large or regular motorcycle and turn right on a wide road, it is dangerous to move from a left lane to a right lane abruptly, so you should gradually enter the right lane for turning right before approaching an intersection.
84. When turning right on a moped at an intersection that has this traffic sign, you must not indicate right turn until you reach the intersection.
85. When you apply the brakes of your motorcycle, it is better to do it by always letting out the clutch.
86. When you push your motorcycle on foot with its engine running, you are regarded as a pedestrian.
87. In the event of a traffic accident, you have to prevent the occurrence of further traffic accidents, move your vehicle to a safer place out of the way of other traffic and turn off the engine.

88. When no one is injured in a traffic accident resulting in property damage, you do not need to report the traffic accident to police if the parties involved in the traffic accident can settle it by negotiation.

89. In the event of a big earthquake, if you have no choice but to leave your vehicle on the road to evacuate the area you must turn off the engine, take out the engine key, close the windows, and lock the door.
90. The combination of numbers in an inspection sticker glued on the windshield indicates the year and month of next inspection.
